testcase.name: check_that_extracted_splunk_app_contains_default_app_conf_file
testcase.system-out: Check that the extracted Splunk App contains a default/app.conf file.

testcase.name: check_that_extracted_splunk_app_does_not_contain_files_with_invalid_permissions
testcase.system-out: Check that the extracted Splunk App does not contain any files with incorrect permissions. Files must have the owner's permissions include read and write (600).

testcase.name: check_that_extracted_splunk_app_does_not_contain_invalid_directories
testcase.system-out: Check that the extracted Splunk App does not contain any directories with incorrect permissions. Directories and subdirectories must have the owner's permissions set to r/w/x (700).

testcase.name: check_that_extracted_splunk_app_does_not_contain_prohibited_directories_or_files
testcase.system-out: Check that the extracted Splunk App does not contain any directories or files that start with a ., or directories that start with __MACOSX.

testcase.name: check_that_splunk_app_package_does_not_contain_files_outside_of_app
testcase.system-out: Check that the Splunk App package does not contain any non-app files. Files within a valid app folder or valid dependencies within a .dependencies folder are permitted, all other files are not.

testcase.name: check_that_splunk_app_package_extracts_to_visible_directory
testcase.system-out: Check that the compressed artifact extracts to a directory that does not start with a . character.

testcase.name: check_that_splunk_app_package_has_read_permission
testcase.system-out: Check that the Splunk app provided does not contain incorrect permissions. Packages must have the owner's read permission set to r (400).

testcase.name: check_that_splunk_app_package_has_valid_static_dependencies
testcase.system-out: Check that the Splunk App package contains only valid dependencies. Dependencies are valid if a .dependencies directory contains only valid app packages inside.

testcase.name: check_that_splunk_app_package_name_does_not_start_with_period
testcase.system-out: Check that the Splunk app provided does not start with a . character.

testcase.name: check_that_splunk_app_package_valid_compressed_file
testcase.system-out: Check that the Splunk app provided a valid compressed file.

testcase.name: check_that_splunk_app_package_with_static_dependencies_has_exactly_one_app_folder
testcase.system-out: Check that the Splunk App package with a .dependencies directory also contains exactly one valid app folder.

testcase.name: check_valid_version_number
testcase.system-out: Check that the extracted Splunk App contains a default/app.conf file that contains an [id] or [launcher] stanza with a version property that is formatted as Major.Minor.Revision.
testcase.warning: No `[id]` section found in app.conf file. File: default/app.conf

testcase.name: check_requires_adobe_flash
testcase.system-out: Check that the app does not use Adobe Flash files.

testcase.name: check_that_extracted_splunk_app_does_not_contains_only_app_conf_file
testcase.system-out: Check that the extracted Splunk App does not contain only app.conf

testcase.name: check_that_splunk_app_package_with_static_dependencies_has_app_manifest
testcase.system-out: Check that the Splunk App package with a .dependencies directory also contains an app folder with an app.manifest.

testcase.name: check_role_map_should_not_map_splunk_system_role
testcase.system-out: Check that all map roles defined in authentication.conf do not map to splunk-system-role.

testcase.name: check_saml_auth_should_not_turn_off_signed_assertion
testcase.system-out: Check that saml-* stanzas in authentication.conf do not turn off signedAssertion property.

testcase.name: check_scripted_authentication_has_valid_python_version_property
testcase.system-out: Check that all the scripted authentications defined in authentication.conf are explicitly set the python.version to python3.

testcase.name: check_authorize_conf_capability_not_modified
testcase.system-out: Check that authorize.conf does not contain any modified capabilities.

testcase.name: check_idx_binary_compatibility
testcase.system-out: Checks that binaries that are distributed to the IDX tier of a distributed Splunk platform deployment are compatible with aarch64.

testcase.name: check_alert_actions_conf_for_alert_execute_cmd_properties
testcase.system-out: Check that commands referenced in the alert.execute.cmd property of all alert actions are checked for compliance with Splunk Cloud security policy. Prevent alert_actions.conf from being used to execute malicious commands.

testcase.name: check_authorize_conf_admin_all_objects_privileges
testcase.system-out: Check that authorize.conf does not grant excessive administrative permissions to the user. Prevent roles from gaining unauthorized permissions.

testcase.name: check_default_data_ui_file_allow_list
testcase.system-out: Check that directories under data/ui contain only allowed files. Ensure unnecessary, unwanted files are not bundled in the app inappropriately.

testcase.name: check_default_data_ui_manager_for_plain_text_credentials
testcase.system-out: Check that directories under data/ui contain only allowed files. Identify for manual review items that might cause passwords to be stored in plaintext.

testcase.name: check_distsearch_conf_for_concerning_replicated_file_size
testcase.system-out: Check if concerningReplicatedFileSize in distsearch.conf is larger than 50 MB.

testcase.name: check_indexes_conf_only_uses_splunk_db_variable
testcase.system-out: Check that indexes defined in indexes.conf use relative paths starting with $SPLUNK_DB

testcase.name: check_inputs_conf_batch_has_required_attributes
testcase.system-out: Check that batch input has required attributes. The following key/value pairs are required for batch inputs: move_policy = sinkhole

testcase.name: check_inputs_conf_for_batch
testcase.system-out: Check that batch input accesses files in a permitted way. To be permissible, the batch input must meet the following criteria: 1) The file path needs to match a file in the directory "$SPLUNK_HOME/var/spool/splunk/" 2) The file name needs to be application specific "$SPLUNK_HOME/etc/apps/" 3) The file name should not end with "stash" or "stash_new"

testcase.name: check_lookups_allow_list
testcase.system-out: Check that lookups/ contains only approved file types (.csv, .csv.default, .csv.gz, .csv.tgz, .kmz) or files formatted as valid csv. Ensure malicious files are not passed off as lookup files.

testcase.name: check_metadata_allow_list
testcase.system-out: Check that the metadata/ and users/<username>/metadata directories do not contain any subdirectories and only contain .meta files. Ensure malicious files are not passed off as metadata files.

testcase.name: check_scripted_inputs_python_version
testcase.system-out: Check that python version is python3 for scripted inputs defined in inputs.conf.

testcase.name: check_setup_xml
testcase.system-out: Check that setup.xml does not exist in the app default or local folders.

testcase.name: check_stanza_of_authentication_conf
testcase.system-out: Check that only role-mapping stanza is allowed in authenticaiton.conf as long as it doesn't map users to a cloud-internal role.

testcase.name: check_static_directory_file_allow_list
testcase.system-out: Check that the static/ directory does not contains any subdirectories and contains only known file types. Ensure malicious files are not passed off as metadata files.

testcase.name: check_audit_conf_deny_list

testcase.name: check_bookmarks_conf_deny_list

testcase.name: check_default_mode_conf_deny_list

testcase.name: check_for_binary_files_without_source_code
testcase.system-out: Check that all executable binary files have matching source code. For any binary files, there should be a source code provided with the same name. testcase.name: check_for_inputs_fifo_usage

testcase.name: check_simplexml_standards_version
testcase.system-out: Check that the dashboards in your app have a valid version attribute.

testcase.name: check_limits_conf
testcase.system-out: Check that default/limits.conf or local/limits.conf or users/<username>/local/limits/conf has not been included.

testcase.name: check_if_outputs_conf_exists
testcase.system-out: Check that forwarding enabled in 'outputs.conf' is failed in cloud

testcase.name: check_deprecated_eventtype_autodiscovering
testcase.system-out: Check for use of findtypes SPL command in .conf files and SimpleXML.

testcase.name: check_for_savedsearches_used_in_eventtypes_conf
testcase.system-out: Check that saved searches are not used within event types. https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/5.0/ReleaseNotes/Deprecatedfeatures https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/7.2.5/Knowledge/Abouteventtypes

testcase.name: check_crawl_conf_deny_list
testcase.system-out: Check that app does not contain crawl.conf as it was deprecated & removed in Splunk.

testcase.name: check_for_viewstates_conf
testcase.system-out: Check that viewstates.conf does not exist at local/viewstates.conf, default/viewstates.conf or users/<username>/local/viewstates.conf in the app. (http://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/6.0/AdvancedDev/Migration#Viewstates_are_no_longer_supported_in_simple_XML)

testcase.name: check_for_datamodel_acceleration_endpoint_usage
testcase.system-out: Check that deprecated datamodel/acceleration is not used. https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/6.2.0/RESTREF/RESTknowledge

testcase.name: check_for_dashboard_xml_list_element
testcase.system-out: Check Dashboard XML files for <list> element. <list>was deprecated in Splunk 6.2 and removed in Splunk 6.5.

testcase.name: check_for_earliest_time_and_latest_time_elements_in_dashboard_xml
testcase.system-out: Check for the deprecated <earliestTime> and <latestTime> elements in dashboard XML files.As of version 6.2 these elements are replaced by <earliest> and <latest> elements.

testcase.name: check_for_populating_search_element_in_dashboard_xml
testcase.system-out: Check for the deprecated <populatingSearch> and <populatingSavedSearch> elements in dashboard XML files.Use the <search> element instead.

testcase.name: check_for_simple_xml_row_grouping
testcase.system-out: Check for the deprecated grouping attribute of row node in Simple XML files.Use the <panel> node instead.

testcase.name: check_for_run_script_alert_action
testcase.system-out: Check for use of running a script in alert action

testcase.name: check_for_django_bindings
testcase.system-out: Check for use of Django bindings.

testcase.name: check_for_simple_xml_option_element_with_name_previewresults
testcase.system-out: Check for the deprecated <option name='previewResults'> in Simple XML files.

testcase.name: check_for_simple_xml_search_related_element
testcase.system-out: Check for the deprecated <searchTemplate>, <searchString>, <searchName>, and <searchPostProcess> element in Simple XML files. Use the <search> element instead.

testcase.name: check_for_simple_xml_seed_element
testcase.system-out: Check for the deprecated <seed> option in Simple XML forms. Use the <initialValue> element instead.

testcase.name: check_for_noninteger_height_option

testcase.name: check_validate_json_data_is_well_formed
testcase.system-out: Check that all JSON files are well formed.

testcase.name: check_for_lookups_file_name
testcase.system-out: Check that no two files/directories under the lookups directory have this naming pattern respectively:xxx and xxx.default - with the only difference in the .default extension.During the installation of an app in Splunk Cloud, a lookup file will be temporarily renamed to append an additional.default extension to it, which will cause error if a namesake file already exists.

testcase.name: check_for_gratuitous_cron_scheduling
testcase.system-out: check that savedsearches.conf searches are cron scheduledreasonably. Less than five asterisks should be used.

testcase.name: check_for_real_time_saved_searches_for_cloud
testcase.system-out: Check that no real-time pre-index saved searches are being used insavedsearches.conf. Real-time pre-index saved searches are extremelysystem intensive and should be avoided.

testcase.name: check_for_sched_saved_searches_action_script_filename
testcase.system-out: Check that savedsearch.conf stanzas do not contain action.script.filename option

testcase.name: check_for_sched_saved_searches_earliest_time
testcase.system-out: Check that if a scheduled saved search in savedsearch.conf contains dispatch.earliest_time option, or if a scheduled saved search with auto summary enabled contains auto_summarize.dispatch.earliest_time option

testcase.name: check_for_sched_saved_searches_latest_time
testcase.system-out: Check that if a savedsearch.conf stanza contains scheduling optionsit does contain a dispatch.latest_time

testcase.name: check_for_saved_searches_populate_lookup
testcase.system-out: Check that savedsearch.conf stanza do not contain action.populate_lookup option`.

testcase.name: check_custom_conf_replication
testcase.system-out: Check that custom .conf files have a a matching conf_replication_include.<conf_file_name> value in server.conf, under the [shclustering] stanza, to ensure that configurations are synchronized across Search Head Clusters.
testcase.warning: App contains one or more custom configs but does not have a `[shclustering]` stanza in server.conf. File: default/server.conf

testcase.name: check_for_default_splunk_app
testcase.system-out: Check that id attribute under the package stanza in app.confdoes not match with the Splunk Default App names

testcase.name: check_for_trigger_stanza
testcase.system-out: Check that default/app.conf, local/app.conf and all users/<username>/local/app.conf don't have a reload.<CONF_FILE>, where CONF_FILE is a non-custom conf. (https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/latest/Admin/Appconf#.5Btriggers.5D)

testcase.name: check_for_valid_package_id
testcase.system-out: Check that the [package] stanza in app.conf has a valid id value.See https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/latest/Admin/Appconf for details.
testcase.warning: Splunk App packages doesn't contain `app.manifest file`. No `app.manifest` was found., No [id] stanza specified in app.conf. An id` attribute in the [id] stanza is required for app installation. Add an [id] stanza to app.conf with `name` attribute File: default/app.conf

testcase.name: check_for_valid_ui_label
testcase.system-out: Check that the default/app.conf or local/app.conf or users/<username>/local/app.conf contains a label key value pair in the [ui] stanza and the length is between 5 and 80 characters inclusive.

testcase.name: check_reload_trigger_for_all_custom_confs
testcase.system-out: Check that custom config files have a corresponding reload trigger in app.conf. Without a reload trigger the app will request a restart on any change to the config file, which may be a negative experience for end-users.

testcase.name: check_no_install_source_checksum
testcase.system-out: Check in default/app.conf, 'local/app.conf' and each users/<username>/local/app.conf, that install_source_checksum not be set explicitly.

testcase.name: check_no_install_source_local_checksum
testcase.system-out: Check in default/app.conf, 'local/app.conf' and each `users/<username/local/app.conf, that install_source_local_checksum not be set explicitly.

testcase.name: check_that_setup_has_not_been_performed
testcase.system-out: Check that default/app.conf setting is_configured = False.

testcase.name: check_that_local_does_not_exist
testcase.system-out: Check that the 'local' directory does not exist. All configuration should be in the 'default' directory.

testcase.name: check_filenames_for_spaces
testcase.system-out: Check that app has no .conf or dashboard filenames that contain spaces. Splunk software does not support such files.

testcase.name: check_for_local_meta
testcase.system-out: Check that the file 'local.meta' does not exist. All metadata permissions should be set in 'default.meta'.

testcase.name: check_that_app_name_config_is_valid
testcase.system-out: Check that the app name does not start with digits

testcase.name: check_that_local_passwords_conf_does_not_exist
testcase.system-out: Check that local/passwords.conf or `users//local/passwords.conf does not exist. Password files are not transferable between instances.

testcase.name: check_collections_conf_for_specified_name_field_type
testcase.system-out: Check that the field.<name> type in collections.conf does not include boolean.Use bool instead.

testcase.name: check_config_file_parsing_public
testcase.system-out: Check that all config files parse cleanly- no trailing whitespace after continuations, no duplicated stanzas or options.

testcase.name: check_manipulation_outside_of_app_container
testcase.system-out: Check that app conf files do not point to files outside the app container. Because hard-coded paths won't work in Splunk Cloud, we don't consider to check absolute paths.

testcase.name: check_no_default_stanzas
testcase.system-out: Check that app does not contain any .conf files that create global definitions using the [default] stanza.

testcase.name: check_coldToFrozenScript_has_valid_python_version_property
testcase.system-out: Check that all the coldToFrozenScript in indexes.conf are explicitly set the python.version to python3.

testcase.name: check_indexes_conf_properties
testcase.system-out: Check that indexes.conf only contains the required 'homePath' , 'coldPath', and 'thawedPath' properties or the optional 'frozenTimePeriodInSecs', 'disabled', 'datatype' and 'repFactor' properties. All other properties are prohibited. Also, if repFactor property exists, it's value should be 'auto'. This check is cloud only because indexes are not allowed via check_indexes_conf_does_not_exist.

testcase.name: check_lower_cased_index_names
testcase.system-out: Check that all index names consist only of lowercase characters, numbers, underscores and hyphens. They cannot begin with an underscore or hyphen, or contain the word 'kvstore'. If index names have any uppercase characters any attempts to edit the index in the UI will cause a duplicate index stanza creation which will cause many errors in Splunk.

testcase.name: check_validate_default_indexes_not_modified
testcase.system-out: Check that no default Splunk indexes are modified by the app.

testcase.name: check_kos_are_accessible
testcase.system-out: Check that knowledge objects with access control restrictions defined in *.meta files are accessible to customers in Splunk Cloud.
testcase.warning: The 'admin' role is not available to Splunk Cloud customers. Please consider also including the 'sc_admin' role if you want Splunk Cloud customer administrators to be able to access this knowledge object File: metadata/default.meta Line Number: 5

testcase.name: check_pretrained_sourcetypes_have_only_allowed_transforms
testcase.system-out: Check that pretrained sourctypes in props.confhave only 'TRANSFORM-' or 'SEDCMD' settings,and that those transforms only modify the host, source, or sourcetype.

testcase.name: check_props_conf_has_no_ingest_eval_lookups
testcase.system-out: Check that the props.conf does not contain lookup() usage in INGEST_EVAL options. This feature is not available in Splunk Cloud. For example: [lookup1] INGEST_EVAL= status_detail=lookup("http_status.csv", json_object("status", status), json_array("status_description"))

testcase.name: check_server_conf_only_contains_custom_conf_sync_stanzas_or_diag_stanza
testcase.system-out: Check that server.conf in an app is only allowed to contain: 1. conf_replication_include.\<custom_conf_files> in [shclustering] stanza 2. or EXCLUDE-\<class> property in [diag] stanza,

testcase.name: check_alert_actions_exe_exist
testcase.system-out: Check that each custom alert action has a valid executable. If it does, further check if the executable is Python script. If it does, further check it's Python 3 compatible.

testcase.name: check_for_explict_exe_args
testcase.system-out: Check whether any custom alert actions have executable arguments.

testcase.name: check_for_payload_format
testcase.system-out: Check that each custom alert action's payload format has a value of xml or json.

testcase.name: check_command_scripts_python_version
testcase.system-out: Check that commands.conf must explicitly define the python.version to be python3 for each python-scripted custom command.

testcase.name: check_workflow_actions_link_uri_does_not_use_http_protocol
testcase.system-out: Check that for each workflow action in workflow_actions.conf the link.uri property uses the https protocol for external links. Unencrypted http is permitted for internal links.

testcase.name: check_restmap_conf_exists
testcase.system-out: Check that restmap.conf file exists at default/restmap.conf, local/restmap.conf and users//local/restmap.conf` when using REST endpoints.

testcase.name: check_rest_handler_python_executable_exists
testcase.system-out: Check that python version is python3 for executables in restmap.conf.

testcase.name: check_rest_handler_scripts_exist_for_cloud
testcase.system-out: Check that each stanza in restmap.conf has a matching handler script.if not, throw a warning.
